intro: Eritrichium fulvum, commonly known as the yellow erin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Eritrichium fulvum is characterized by its hairy leaves and compact growth habit, making it a distinctive member of its genus. It is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates.
